Rockville.National Institute on Alcohol Abuse and: The National Institute on Alcohol Abuse and Alcoholism (NIAAA), as part of the U.S. National Institutes of Health, supports and conducts biomedical and behavioral research on the causes, consequences, treatment, and prevention of alcoholism and alcohol-related problems. The NIAAA functions both as a funding agency that supports research by external research institutions and as a research institution itself, where alcohol research is carried out in‐house. It funds approximately 90 percent of all such research in the United States and promotes neo-Prohibitionisist approaches to reducing the severe and sometimes fatal consequences of alcohol consumption.
